Title: Facets - Options
DescriptionLines: Several options can be configured on the aggregated result list returned from a Faceted Search.
* Skipping results
* Paging results
* Get remaining items summary
* Sort Order

Walkthroughs.Title: Define an index
DescriptionLines: * Define an index on the collection you would like to query.
(CategoryName is loaded from a related document).
* The index entry fields will be used to define the Facets (see step-2).

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a Facet
DescriptionLines: Define the following per `Facet` object that will be added to the facet list:
* _field_name_ - The index entry field by which the documents will be grouped.
* _options_ - Define `FacetOptions` for the result list:
Options are relevant only for the _Facet_ type (and not for RangeFacet).
* Start - The position from which to send items (how many to skip)
* page_size - Number of items to send
* Include_remaining_terms -
Show summary for items that didn't make it into the requested list pageSize
* term_sort_mode - Set the items sort order in the list
* 2 more optional properties are available (see dedicated demos in the links):
* display_field_name - A customized name for the facet field the results
* aggregations - define the sum, min, max & average per aggregated result
* _In this example_:
'facet1' groups by the content of index field 'CategoryName'.
E.g. all documents containing category 'Seafood' will be grouped into a single item in the aggregated results.
The number of items returned depends on the 'start' and 'pageSize' params.
The aggregated items will be sorted by the documents count per item in a descending order.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Facet list
DescriptionLines: * Define the _list of Facets_ by which to aggregate the documents matching the query criteria.
Initialize it with the Facets from the previous step.
* Any number of Facets can be defined in this list.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on the 'Products' collection using the defined index.
Pass the 'facets' object to the `aggregate_by_facets()` method and execute the query.
* The _query_results_ variable will hold the resulting aggregated items _per Facet_ defined.
The items returned are dependent on the Options settings.
